content.description:
One of the first classics here with a wide variety of climbing. Start on the right of 2 crack then switch to the left. Follow this to a left facing dihedral/chimney capped by a roof.

Starts half way along the left face that form the dihedral of Samurai
standard rack

Starts off with a nice crack, with a hidden bucket prior to the horn, follow up with an easy ramp to a great squeeze chimney. Pro is amazing single rack
belay/rap off tree

The route is to the right of "Diane" in a departure with two horizontal cracks, it starts between two trees.

La voie est à droite de "Diane" dans un départ avec deux fissures horizontales, elle commence entre deux arbres.



Nice route for beginners in top-rope or trad, with long movements. You can go around the left side of the cliff to climb to the top of the route and install a top-rope.

Belle voie pour débuter en moulinette ou en trad, avec de longs mouvement. Vous pouvez contourner par la gauche de la falaise pour monter au sommet de la voie et installer une moulinette.

Bolted anchor at the top

An easy start will lead you to a very thin boulder problem.  The rest of the route is less difficult but still very pleasant.

Un départ aisé vous mènera à un très mince problème de bloc.  Le reste de la voie est moins difficile mais tout de même très plaisant. 



Same start as Escarmouche's left flowing depression but you head straight up aiming to the right of the small overlap.

Même départ que la dépression coulant à gauche d'Escarmouche mais vous vous dirigez tout droit vers la droite du petit chevauchement.


Mixed, 5 bolts. Fixed anchor.

climbs.name: Coexistence
climbs.fa: Paul Laperriere, Christiane Lelievre, Guy Lacelle, 07/07/1980

content.description:
Step up onto the slab and head up the finger crack/flake on the left of the corner. 
 Traverse right to the small ledge, mantle up, climb up the corner to the roof. 
 Follow the roof left unto a tricky move left to the ledge. 
 You keep traversing left around the corner to the bolted anchor shared with Hara-Kiri, Micheline, Absolution.

Standard rack, plenty of runners, protect for your second!

Nice route for beginners in top-rope or trad with a small crux at the end of the route under a small roof. You can go around the left side of the cliff to climb to the top of the route and install a top-rope.

Belle voie pour débuter en moulinette ou en trad avec un petit crux à la fin de voie sous un petit toit. Vous pouvez contourner par la gauche de la falaise pour monter au sommet de la voie et installer une moulinette.



The route is on the left of "aurore" in an obvious dihedral, it starts at the foot of a tree.

La voie est à gauche de "aurore" dans un dièdre évident, elle commence au pied d'un arbre.

Standard rack and bolted anchor at the top

Tremendous finger crack to reach a ledge then left of the roof for a slabby finish.



Left of the middle tree in the obvious crack.

One bolt & finger sized cams.

You can go around the left side of the cliff to climb to the top of the route and install a top-rope.

Vous pouvez contourner par la gauche de la falaise pour monter au sommet de la voie et installer une moulinette.



The route is to the right of "Coïncidence" with a start just to the left of a tree

La voie est à droite de "Coïncidence" avec un départ juste à gauche d'un arbre.

Bolted anchor at the top

climbs.name: Hara-Kiri
climbs.fa: Paul Laperriere, June 24 1988, top Francois Roy, summer 1987 FFA: Paul Laperriere, July 1989 1981

content.description:
Climb the face past 3 bolts to the left edge of the cave belay. Then climb out left to a bolt and up to a final bolt just below the top.

gear + 5 bolts

This is a worthwhile crack climb on the left side of the left crag in La Bleue. Climb the left leaning crack with good hand jams and gear for 25 feet before stepping right to exit onto a little dihedral and finish up a dirty ramp. Then look up for a 2 bolt anchor on right side on which it is also possible to set up a TR. This is a much easier climb than Samuraï -- particularly with any crack climbing skills. Il s'agit d'une voie en fissure intéressante sur le côté gauche du rocher gauche de La Bleue. Grimpez la fissure inclinée vers la gauche avec de bonnes prises de main et de la bonne protection sur 25 pieds avant de faire un pas vers la droite pour sortir sur un petit dièdre et finir sur une rampe sale. Cherchez ensuite un relaisancre à 2 bolts sur le côté droit, sur laquelle il est également possible d'installer une moulinette. C'est une voie beaucoup plus facile que Samuraï, surtout si vous savez grimper des fissures. It is the second obvious crack from the left - about 30 feet right from the offwidth 'Limace'.

C'est la deuxième fissure évidente en partant de la gauche - à environ 30 pieds à droite de l'offwidth "Limace". Anchors on top.

Relais en haut.

climbs.name: L'Absolution
climbs.fa: FA Paul Laperriere, June 24 1988, FFA July 1989

content.description:
Head up the face just right of the Micheline crack and left of the corner. Head up the face past the horizontals through the black textured face with the bolt. There's an extension of the route which follows an unprotected line between Saké and Quantum. Grimpez la face a droite de la fissure de Micheline et larête a droite. Continuez tout droit passe les fissures horizontales et suivez la tracée noire (plaquette). Il y a une extension de la voie qui n'est pas protégée qui passe entre Saké etQuantum. Bolted belay/rap
Small rack

As you might guess in the title, this is not really a sustained route. Begin four feet to the right of Andromède (5.9 and a better start) on a v0 boulder problem to gain a ledge. At this, you will have to make a bold move to a horizontal and trend left to get your first gear in a dihedral. From here, go up and trend left laybacking to gain a position on a dirty ledge while slinging a tree for pro, and continuing left. At this point you can make a push past a couple of branches to what would be a nice crack if clean (5.5) finally mantling to the left to the anchors shared with Parcimonie. Or climb the dihedral farther left (much more sparse and smaller gear required while making the best of small crimps and stemming) in the 5.8 range.  Two glue ins at top. Start to the right of the steep wall (Parcimonie is the first route there) and around the corner left of the Samurai wall. Small rack with micro cams / nuts to a #1. Two bolt anchor.

climbs.name: Les Petits Poussaient
climbs.fa: Pierre Cornelier, Martine Lavallée, Vicky Amiot, Youri Del Rio & Patrick Prénovost

content.description:
Head up the arete on the right of Coexistence, head up the face to the anchor.

Bolts + BD #1

Wonder why you got that #5 and #6 sitting at home or in your trunk? this is it! Climb up the off-width and then traverse left along the large horizontal crack (nearly no feet) to a ledge and a large tree. 
  
 ---- 
  
 La raison que vous avez un #5 et #6 qui traine a la maison ou le coffre de la voiture. 
 Grimpez la grosse fissure puis négotier la transition et la traverse horizontale vers la gauche, montez sur la vire et le petit coin jusqu'à l'arbre.

#5 & #6 for the off-width then 4-5 fist size pieces for the traverse (#1-#3)

climbs.name: Micheline
climbs.fa: Paul Laperriere, 1980 FFA: Marc Blais, Normand Cadieux, Summer 1981

content.description:
A hard finger crack start to the second horizontal crack. Traverse right and turn the arete. Then make some face moves [TCU] to the right end of the cave. A second pitch can be added if you do Sake 5.9 Near the right end of the cliff and left of the arete you'll find a rectangular cave half way up the cliff. This route starts at a finger crack directly below it. Finger to off finger. Bring a hand size to protect the move into the cave belay. A few long slings.
bolted anchor

Sustained with an airy finish

gear + 4 bolts + anchor
First line of bolts right of Samourai Corner.

Classique de la Bleue. Bien protégée. Départ du sol qui n'est pas évidant. Arriver à la première plaquette il y a un passage raide. Une fois ce passage fait, c’est facile jusqu’à l’horizontale (#0.5 Camalot ). Passer le toit, le fun commence sur un mélange de grattons, pochettes, side pull. Votre peau vous dira assez rapidement que ça fait mal :) A must do. Well protected. Start from the ground which is not obvious. Arriving at the first bolt there is a steep section. Once this section is done, it's easy until the horizontal (#0.5 Camalot ). Passing the roof, the fun starts on a mix of crimps, pockets, side pull. Your skin will tell you pretty quickly that it hurts :) Mixte, 4 plaquettes. Ancrage fixe.

Mixed, 4 bolts. Fixed anchor.

climbs.name: Parcimonie
climbs.fa: Paul & Luc Laperriere, March 3 1974 FFA: Guy Lacelle, Summer 1982

content.description:
Make a boulder move to a ledge with great gear. Climb up into some left facing flakes. Backup the pin in the horizontal crack #.3 C4. Fire the slightly overhanging crack to another good horizontal. Finish up a blank looking shallow corner PG13 but easier. The farthest left wall has a rectangular bivi cave low to the ground. Find the appealing finger crack to the right. TCU to finger
Offset grey/yellow Alien helpful for crux.

Short technical face climb. 



Start under the bolts right of micheline's crack. Climb straight up to reach the two upper. Finish on the ledge. 

small gear (to .5), 3 bolts + 2 bolts anchor

This climb is really a second pitch added onto another route. 
 Climb Hara-Kiri 5.11c, Micheline 5.10b or L'Absolution 5.11b to the bolted belay in the cave. From there climb a wide crack to top.

Find the rectangular cave half way up the right side of the cliff beside an arete.
standard rack up to #4 C4

Sustained and physical.  add a few letter grades if you're under 5'5". Once on a small ledge, protect as best you can and make hard slippery moves in and out of the alcove then over a roof to top. Optional belay under roof. Soutenu et physique. Rajoutez quelque lettres a la cote si vous faites moins que 5'5". Une fois sur une petite tablette, protégez le mieux que vous pouvez puis sortez de l’alcôve avec des mouvements difficiles et instables jusqu’à la vire. sortez le coin a votre gauche.  Possibilité de faire un relais sous le toit. Tricky but adequate but not great. There's been a few incidents of pulled gear at the crux.

Délicate.  Il y a eu quelques cas de protection qui ont lachés suite a une chute dans le crux. This is the obvious dihedral in the middle of the sector.

C'est le diedre dans le millieu du grand mur en coin.

It starts with three bolts, this section is supposed to be 5.11b but many of us were surprised to find that "that's a tough one" once the three bolts are over you need three cams 0.5 , 0.75 and #1 or #2. Once on the big ledge, climb the dihedral to get the bolt. From here there are two choices: 1- get the right left grip (jug ramp) and escape to the left 5.11b. 2- go straight up 5.11d. Ca commence avec trois bolts, cette section est supposée être 5.11b mais plusieurs y on eu une bonne surprise «  c’est donc bien dure ce truc là » une fois les trois bolts passées il faut trois cam 0.5 , 0.75 et #1 ou #2. Une fois sur la grosse vire grimper le dièdre pour aller chercher la bolt. D’ici il y a deux choix: 1- aller chercher la bonne prise à gauche (rampe jug) et s’échapper à gauche 5.11b. 2- sortit tout droit 5.11d. Just left of Samouraï  (the three bolts heading left).

Juste à gauche de Samouraï (les trois bolt qui vont vers à la gauche). Bolts et Camalot #.5, #.75 et # 1 ou #2

Interesting and aesthetics from beginning to end. 
 Climb past 4 bolts to a long horizontal crack. Finish on a face with a bolt near the top.

Left of the cave belay on right.
cams and nuts  5 bolts

Face climb up a line of 3 bolts to a horizontal then passing 2 more bolts to top. Many holds broke but the remaining are said to be good.


large nut for horizontal + 5 bolts

Climb Samourai to the optional belay under the roof. Make a long traverse to the cave belay of Sake. Finish as desired or rap.

gear

A zig-zag crag that features high quality hard climbs up to 5.13 as well as some moderates.

Une falaise en zig-zag qui présente des voies difficiles de haute qualité, allant jusqu'à 5,13 ainsi que quelques modérées.
